result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley D Odonnell

defendant.name: Odonnell, Riley D
defendant.address: 13 S 4th St West, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM 21CT311 & 22CM20: Defendant Riley D Odonnell in court.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Riley D Odonnell.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Court reviews recomm.; Def. pleads NC to OWI3rd in Count 1; stip. to facts; Court finds Def. guilty of OWI3rd (repeater stricken) w/Count 3 Dismissed and Counts 2,4,5,6,7 D&RI and 22CM20 is D&RI; State heard; Atty. George-Stifler heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

*1 year in DCJ w/H&Tr. cons. - IMPOSED AND STAYED - 24 mo. PO - 5 days credit if revoked
- 45 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. on or before 9/13/22
- $1,800 F+C = $3,084 w/in 60 days
- $200 DNA surcharge/sample
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not be in presence of anyone who is drinking
- not drive w/o valid DL
* 24 mo. Rev. & IID
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

w/21CT311: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $ 118.58 by next court date. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:53 PM 21CT311 & 22CM20: Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley D Odonnell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Riley D Odonnell by Teri Strohschein; State heard on Def.'s FTA at P&S; State heard on bond, requests $2,000 cash bail; Atty. Strohschein heard; Court orders: $1,500 CASH Bond: prior conditions; Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $118.58 by next court date. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. P&S 7/25/22 at 3:30pm in Br. 3

2:34 PM 21CT311 & 22CM20: Defendant Riley D Odonnell not in court for P&S; Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Riley D Odonnell. Atty. George heard; State heard, has another OWI pending in Dane County that would be 4th, requests bond revoked and warrant issued; Atty. George heard further; Court grants State's request - bond forfeited and warrant authorized
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:47 AM Defendant, Riley D Odonnell in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
